p: It has been proven that nanofibers act as a membrane that actively reduces polyphenol oxidase activity. Such materials can be used for preservation in the food industry in fruit and juice packaging [ 105, 112]. Nanofibers can be coated with biocompatible polymers (hydrolysed collagen, elastin, hyaluronic acid, chondroitin sulfate). In this way, the electrospun fibers are coated with pure polyurethane to use the substance to improve the antibacterial effect of urinary catheters. The membranes thus obtained, have good antimicrobial activity on Escherichia coli, Salmonella typhimurium, Listeria monocytogenes [ 105].
